snippet: For the first time, New York City is closing a charter school for the offense of simply being mediocre, and the action could have widespread implications.
abstract: New York City is closing a charter school for the first time for the offense of simply being mediocre, and action could have widespread implications; city is closing Peninsula Preparatory Charter School in Far Rockaway, Queens; Education Dept has become increasingly impatient with weak-performing schools.
lead_paragraph: For the first time, New York City is closing a charter school for the offense of simply being mediocre, and the action could have widespread implications.

headline.seo: New York City Plans to Close a Charter School for Mediocrity
headline.main: New York City Charter School Finds That a Grade of ‘C’ Means Closing
headline.print_headline: Charter School Finds That ‘C’ Means Closing
